title: How is teaching as a vocation and mission related? - Quora

response.answer_text: Teaching as a lecturer, teacher in “schooling systems”-private/public- is a paid job to earn a living as in any other skills job. Teaching as an evangelical religious outreach can be called a mission for some involved in this enterprise with the caution that many are persuaded by the power and income received to focus only on these two outcomes and view the religious aspect as an incidental marketing tool to get more income. Teaching for some parents is burdensome and leaves it to the community/government as they do not have the time, knowledge or skills to fulfill this task. The community in which one resides decides what are the skills to be taught to keep their community in existence.
Mission related I guess means religion. Way too constraining for me. Being a school teacher is great as a vocation. In HR I did much teaching. Good feeling to help develop students.
I see teaching as a calling. Something higher than yourself pulls you to be a teacher. God bless teachers!!!!! ingrace, Ilene
